summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from July-August 2020, in which the New York Field Office's Squad C-20 (VCACIHT) requests assistance for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation, specifically for help with prepping items for discovery with an end-of-August deadline. It shows internal coordination among FBI agents to allocate resources to the high-profile case.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office who is requesting assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation and is coordinating help for prepping discovery items.

connections.description: Both are FBI agents involved in the internal coordination to secure assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, indicating a professional working relationship within the New York Field Office.

events.title: FBI Squad C-20 Assistance Request
events.description: Squad C-20 (VCACIHT) sends an internal request for assistance related to the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation, describing it as a unique opportunity to assist with a high-profile case.

events.title: Coordination for Office Meeting
events.description: FBI agents coordinate a meeting at the office (290 on the 9th floor) to discuss assistance with the Epstein/Maxwell case, specifically for prepping discovery items.

locations: 290 on the 9th floor (implied to be an FBI New York Field Office location)
keyFacts: The FBI's New York Field Office, specifically Squad C-20 (VCACIHT - Violent Crimes Against Children/International Human Trafficking), was actively seeking internal assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation in July-August 2020.
The assistance needed was for 'prepping items for discovery' with a turnaround time of end of August 2020, indicating active litigation or investigative discovery deadlines.
The email chain characterizes working on the Epstein/Maxwell case as a 'unique opportunity to assist with a high profile case,' showing its prioritized status within the FBI.
The correspondence reveals internal FBI procedural coordination, with agents copying their respective Supervisory Special Agents (SSA) when volunteering for the case.
